metadata.author: G. S. Tutorial
metadata.description: Class 9 Science - Most Important 50 Questions for Final Exam

question.text: Which state of matter has maximum intermolecular forces?
question.explanation: Solids have strongest intermolecular forces, particles closely packed. Gases weakest forces.

question.text: The process of solid directly changing to gas is called:
question.explanation: Sublimation: e.g., camphor, dry ice, iodine. No liquid phase formed.

question.text: Which of these is a pure substance?
question.explanation: Gold is an element. Air, milk, sea water are mixtures with variable composition.

question.text: The method to separate cream from milk is:
question.explanation: Centrifugal force separates lighter cream from heavier milk in dairy industry.

question.text: The number of moles in 52g of He is: (Atomic mass He=4)
question.explanation: Moles = mass/molar mass = 52/4 = 13 moles.

question.text: The formula of sodium carbonate is:
question.explanation: Na⁺ (charge +1) and CO₃²⁻ (charge -2) → Na₂CO₃.

question.text: Which subatomic particle was discovered by J.J. Thomson?
question.explanation: Cathode ray tube experiment (1897). Proton: Goldstein, Neutron: Chadwick, Nucleus: Rutherford.

question.text: Isotopes have same:
question.explanation: Isotopes: same protons (atomic number), different neutrons (mass number).

question.text: Which cell organelle is called "powerhouse of cell"?
question.explanation: Mitochondria produce ATP through cellular respiration.

question.text: Plasmolysis occurs when plant cell is placed in:
question.explanation: Water leaves cell in hypertonic solution → cytoplasm shrinks from cell wall.

question.text: Which tissue connects bone to bone?
question.explanation: Ligament: bone to bone (elastic). Tendon: muscle to bone (less elastic).

question.text: Xylem transports:
question.explanation: Xylem: water/minerals upward. Phloem: food bidirectional.

question.text: Five kingdom classification was proposed by:
question.explanation: Robert Whittaker (1969): Monera, Protista, Fungi, Plantae, Animalia.

question.text: Which phylum includes animals with jointed legs?
question.explanation: Arthropoda: insects, spiders, crustaceans. Largest phylum.

question.text: SI unit of acceleration is:
question.explanation: Acceleration = change in velocity/time = (m/s)/s = m/s².

question.text: Area under velocity-time graph represents:
question.explanation: Area = displacement (vector) or distance (scalar). Slope gives acceleration.

question.text: Newton's first law is also called:
question.explanation: Body at rest/motion stays unless acted by external force. Defines inertia.

question.text: Product of mass and velocity is:
question.explanation: Momentum p = m×v. Vector quantity, conserved in isolated system.

question.text: Value of g on moon is about:
question.explanation: g_moon ≈ 1/6 g_earth = 9.8/6 ≈ 1.63 m/s².

question.text: Weight of object on earth is 60N. On moon it will be:
question.explanation: Weight_moon = Weight_earth/6 = 60/6 = 10 N. Mass same (≈6.12 kg).

question.text: SI unit of work is:
question.explanation: Work = Force × Displacement. 1 J = 1 N·m.

question.text: Kinetic energy of mass m moving at velocity v is:
question.explanation: KE = ½mv². Doubling velocity → 4× KE.

question.text: Sound cannot travel through:
question.explanation: Requires material medium. No particles in vacuum to vibrate.

question.text: Loudness depends on:
question.explanation: Greater amplitude → louder sound. Measured in decibels (dB).

question.text: Which disease is caused by virus?
question.explanation: Common cold: rhinovirus. TB: bacteria, Typhoid: bacteria, Cholera: bacteria.

question.text: BCG vaccine prevents:
question.explanation: BCG (Bacillus Calmette-Guérin) given at birth in many countries.

question.text: Most abundant gas in atmosphere is:
question.explanation: Nitrogen: 78%, Oxygen: 21%, Argon: 0.93%, CO₂: 0.04%.

question.text: Which layer protects from UV radiation?
question.explanation: Ozone (O₃) in stratosphere absorbs harmful UV-B, UV-C.

question.text: Which is a kharif crop?
question.explanation: Kharif: monsoon crops (June-Oct). Rabi: winter crops (Oct-Mar).

question.text: White Revolution is associated with:
question.explanation: Operation Flood (Dr. Verghese Kurien) made India largest milk producer.

question.text: Evaporation causes cooling because:
question.explanation: Latent heat of vaporization absorbed from surface → cooling effect.

question.text: Tyndall effect is shown by:
question.explanation: Colloidal particles scatter light. True solutions don't show Tyndall effect.

question.text: Mass of 1 mole of oxygen atoms is:
question.explanation: Atomic mass O = 16 u → molar mass = 16 g/mol.

question.text: Rutherford's experiment led to discovery of:
question.explanation: Gold foil experiment: most alpha particles passed through → atom mostly empty, dense nucleus at center.

question.text: Lysosomes are called "suicide bags" because:
question.explanation: During cell damage, lysosomes burst → enzymes digest cell contents (autolysis).

question.text: Meristematic tissue is found in:
question.explanation: Apical meristem (tips), lateral meristem (cambium), intercalary meristem (nodes).

question.text: Binomial nomenclature was introduced by:
question.explanation: Genus species format (e.g., Homo sapiens). First capitalized, second lowercase, italicized.

question.text: Distance-time graph for uniform motion is:
question.explanation: Constant slope = constant speed. Horizontal: at rest.

question.text: According to Newton's second law, F =
question.explanation: Force = mass × acceleration. Defines force quantitatively.

question.text: Gravitational constant G has unit:
question.explanation: From F = Gm₁m₂/r² → G = Fr²/m₁m₂ → N·m²/kg².

question.text: Power is defined as:
question.explanation: Rate of doing work. SI unit: Watt (W) = J/s.

question.text: 1 kWh equals:
Pitch of sound depends on:
question.explanation: Higher frequency → higher pitch (shrill). Lower frequency → lower pitch (deep).

question.text: SONAR works on principle of:
question.explanation: Sound Navigation and Ranging: ultrasound emitted, echo detected to measure depth.

question.text: Which is a communicable disease?
question.explanation: Malaria spreads via mosquito. Others are non-communicable.

question.text: Acid rain is caused by:
question.explanation: From industries/vehicles → sulfuric/nitric acid → pH < 5.6.

question.text: Chipko Movement was for:
question.explanation: 1973, Uttarakhand - hugging trees to prevent logging.

question.text: Which is a micronutrient for plants?
question.explanation: Micronutrients needed in trace amounts: Zn, Cu, Fe, Mn, B, Mo, Cl.

question.text: Green Revolution is associated with:
question.explanation: High-yielding varieties of wheat/rice, fertilizers, irrigation (1960s).

question.text: Water has maximum density at:
question.explanation: 1 g/cm³ at 4°C. Expands below 4°C → ice floats.

question.text: Law of constant proportions states:
question.explanation: Proust's law: compound always has same elements in fixed proportion by mass.

question.text: Blood is which type of tissue?
question.explanation: Fluid connective tissue. Plasma matrix + formed elements (RBCs, WBCs, platelets).
